codes.description: A range of qualitative and quantitative methods used in RAND's research, including scenario analysis, historical analysis, case studies, and more.
quotes: Qualitative and quantitative.
Scenario analysis
historical analysis
case studies

codes.description: The necessity for research questions to guide the choice of methods in RAND's research.
quotes: The research question needs to drive this.

codes.description: Emerging trends in integrating tools like tabletop exercises (TTXs) into research designs for data collection and confirming findings.
quotes: A lot of people integrate a TTX into their research design.
I see that as a trend of something we could do.

codes.description: The necessity for better tools for coding interviews to ensure quality and consistency in qualitative research.
quotes: Interview coding, something way better than Dedoose.
the coding is uneven in quality.

codes.description: Concerns regarding the implementation of AI in research processes, particularly its impact on junior staff and competitive positioning.
quotes: The risk is that we will end up utilizing AI for stuff our junior folks used to do.
I do think that is a risk.

interview_id: Focus Group on AI and Methods 7_7
filename: Focus Group on AI and Methods 7_7.docx

codes.description: The effort to bring together a diverse group of individuals to share insights and learn from each other.
quotes: the whole point of this is to bring a diverse group of people together.

codes.description: The various research methods employed by participants in their work, including qualitative and quantitative techniques.
quotes: most of my work is more quantitative

codes.description: The difficulties faced in qualitative research, particularly in designing effective protocols and finding the right questions.
quotes: the hardest is to find the right questions
you need the most knowledgeable people, experts who can give you the most information

codes.description: The intricate processes involved in collecting data, especially when new data collection instruments are required.
quotes: designing the data collection instrument

codes.description: The application of artificial intelligence tools to assist in various aspects of research, including data analysis and coding.
quotes: AI helps a lot

codes.description: A set of statistical techniques used to estimate causal relationships, particularly in policy evaluation settings.
quotes: First difference-in-difference, that literature on those techniques has evolved a lot in the last 5-10 years so advanced methods that build on that but difference-in-difference is pretty common.
Synthetic control methods to get it look like an rct.
Instrumental variables approach and then other techniques that fall into this bucket though less consensus to identifying causal effect.

codes.description: The application of artificial intelligence tools to assist in various research tasks, including coding, proposal writing, and literature reviews.
quotes: I have used AI tools to help with my code.
The other thing that I did was a year ago now and not a causal inference, but we did write a python script to use the RAND CHAT to review a bunch of papers.

codes.description: Concerns and barriers faced by researchers regarding the use of AI tools in their work.
quotes: I don’t want to inadvertently take someone else’s intellectual property.
I guess if you are coding work that classified.

codes.description: The processes in causal inference research that require significant time investment, such as data preparation and code checking.
quotes: the time-consuming process of pulling data down, checking code.
But the time-consuming process of pulling data down, checking code.

codes.description: The perceived necessity for education and training on the effective use of AI tools within the organization.
quotes: There could be more along those lines, showcasing how ppl use it successfully.
I told several ppl how I use it to check my proposals and esp. this year with changes in funding.
